premise: The graph shows the skydiver's vertical movement. During the 10 to 15 seconds interval, the velocity is constant at 10 m/s.
conclusion: The distance fallen can be calculated as the product of the constant velocity and the time interval.

premise: The velocity is constant at 10 m/s during the 10 to 15 seconds interval.
conclusion: The distance fallen from 10 to 15 seconds is \(10 \, \text{m/s} \times 5 \, \text{s} = 50 \, \text{m}\).
